title: >>> There's a New SHERIFF In TOWN
body_text:
A battle for the city ... okay, maybe not. But still, the tension between Ray Marzarella and Dan Turner reached its climax this past Saturday. Twenty events following the infamous
Invasion of LX3
, the question remained ... Would an unblemished record remain in tact or would the desire for revenge conquer all?
>> Ray Marzarella vs. Dan Turner
Word Association ...
Pond Scum
:
Controversy
Anytime you have members of
Pond Scum
in the spotlight, one can never predict the outcome. At first, there was nothing out of the ordinary as right from the getgo both armies traded victories throughout the first hour of play. But it wasn't long before controversy reigned supreme.
Game 4's conclusion witnessed the rather sudden departure of one Dan Turner, having become frustrated with the equally controversial finish of the same game. Dan left without warning, leaving his confused team without a captain. Turner's exit comes as one of dodgeball's unsolved shockers as the score was deadlocked at 2. It was still anybody's ballgame!
With one-half of the night's main event absent, the carnage of DODGEBALL EIGHTY-THREE continued without hesitation.
In a dodgeball rarity, Team DAN without its head man, defeated Team RAY in a highly contested bout, one that could have swung either way.
-- Ray's winning games: 1, 4, 5, 9
-- Dan's winning games: 2, 3, 6, 7, 8, 10
And again, though Dan did depart early, the records will indicate victory in his name. In fairness to Ray, a rematch should take place some time down the road.
Moments & Stars
: Diana DiBuccio's game-saving eliminations during one of the earlier games; Alison Bertsch receiving violent bodyshots all night long; impactful faceshots on Grant Cornero and Ray Marzarella; the uncanny power of high school star Mark Pellecchia.
"It's an adrenaline rush every time I step on the court. I can only imagine what the weeks ahead will bring."
- JOHN TRONOLONE
Statistics of EIGHTY-THREE
> Attendance: 20
> Biggest Return: Jim Martin (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 70)
> New Players: (2) Mark Pellecchia, Mary Daniel
- This was the second week in a row Dan Spengeman created the promotional poster.
- DODGEBALL EIGHTY-THREE was the 17th
Wet War
, the third
Wet War
in four events.
- Dan Turner defeated Ray Marzarella at EIGHTY-THREE, breaking Ray's undefeated captains record. This is Dan's first win as captain.
- Juan Londono missed his first event since debuting at DODGEBALL 73.
DODGEBALL 84: Basista is Back!
Young prodigy
Sascha Basista
is back in action at DODGEBALL 84 after going on a brief hiatus. The reckless dodger is set to headline the event, with his rival captain still unknown. It is heavily rumored however that one
Lenny Herrera
may fill the void.
Stayed tuned to
dodgeball.livejournal.com
for more on this development.
________________________________________
_________
DODGEBALL 85 to DODGEBALL 90
Perhaps more than ever, captains battles have created enduring feuds and continue to raise the overall levels of intensity, competition, and fun like never before. The remaining events of Season 9 are filling up quickly with never-before-seen encounters set in place.
The poll below actually reveals some of the encounters already agreed upon by the participants. When they will occur remains a mystery.
Voting is open!
Which match interests you the most?
Mike Edwards vs. Mike Butler
Alison Bertsch vs. Melissa Kerr
Liz Nogueira vs. Kathryn Nogueira
Kevin Adams vs. Grant Cornero

Twenty events following the infamous Invasion of LX3, the question remained ... Would an unblemished record remain in tact or would the desire for revenge conquer all?
